subject: Re: [PATCH] zsmalloc: introduce SG-list based object read API

reviews.author: Herbert Xu
reviews.summary: Herbert Xu approved the patch and gave an Acked-by tag, indicating he reviewed it but did not provide any specific technical comments.

reviews.author: Yosry Ahmed
reviews.summary: Reviewer Yosry Ahmed raised concerns about the patch introducing SG-list based object read API for zsmalloc. They tested the patch with the zswap patch and suggested including it in the next revision. They also pointed out issues with the return value of zs_obj_read_sg_begin() being always 0, duplication between this and zs_obj_read_begin(), and potential simplification by moving spanning logic into zram.

reviews.author: Sergey Senozhatsky (author)
reviews.summary: Reviewer suggested removing memcpy API for this dev cycle and converting zram in a future cycle.

reviews.author: Nhat Pham
reviews.summary: Nhat Pham approved the patch and acknowledged it has landed in mm-stable, but initially questioned whether it was just a style change.
